title: Andrejs Prohorenkovs
text:
Andrejs Prohorenkovs (born 5 February 1977 in <a href="Ogre%2C%20Latvia">Ogre</a>) is a <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Midfielder%20%28association%20football%29">midfielder</a>, currently playing for <a href="FK%20Ogre">FK Ogre</a> in the <a href="Latvian%20First%20League">Latvian First League</a>. He also works as the manager of the club.
Club career.
Prohorenkovs started his career with Interskonto in the <a href="Latvian%20Higher%20League">Latvian Higher League</a>, and has since played for <a href="Hutnik%20Warszawa">Hutnik Warszawa</a>, <a href="Odra%20Opole">Odra Opole</a> and <a href="G%C3%B3rnik%20Zabrze">Górnik Zabrze</a> in <a href="Poland">Poland</a>, <a href="Maccabi%20Kiryat%20Gat%20F.C.">Maccabi Kiryat Gat</a> and <a href="Maccabi%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Maccabi Tel Aviv</a> in <a href="Israel">Israel</a>, <a href="FC%20Dynamo%20Moscow">Dynamo Moscow</a> in <a href="Russia">Russia</a>, Melnā Roze and <a href="FK%20J%C5%ABrmala">FK Jūrmala</a> in <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a>, <a href="Racing%20de%20Ferrol">Racing de Ferrol</a> in <a href="Spain">Spain</a>, <a href="Ionikos%20F.C.">Ionikos</a> in <a href="Greece">Greece</a>, <a href="FK%20Liep%C4%81jas%20Metalurgs">Liepājas Metalurgs</a>, <a href="FC%20J%C5%ABrmala">FC Jūrmala</a> and <a href="FK%20Ogre">FK Ogre</a> in <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a>.
Prior to the 2014 <a href="Latvian%20First%20League">Latvian First League</a> (second tier) season Prohorenkovs was appointed as the manager of <a href="FK%20Ogre">FK Ogre</a>, also remaining a player's role.
International career.
As a <a href="Latvia%20national%20football%20team">Latvian international</a> he played 32 international matches and scored 4 goals in the period from year 2002 till 2007. He debuted in 2002, and played at the <a href="Euro%202004">Euro 2004</a>, making an assist for <a href="M%C4%81ris%20Verpakovskis">Māris Verpakovskis</a> in Latvia's tournament opening goal against <a href="Czech%20Republic%20national%20football%20team">Czech Republic</a>.
